title: Eden Hazard: I am more complete than when named Player of the Year

organizations.name: professional footballers' association and football writers' association

text:
44/44 Getty Images 
Eden Hazard believes he is a more complete player than when he was named the Footballer of the Year and admits he prefers getting fouled than being left alone. 
Hazard scored one of the goals of the season as Chelsea beat London rivals Arsenal 3-1 at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. 
The Belgium international was named the best player in the Premier League by the Professional Footballers' Association and Football Writers' Association when Chelsea won the title two years ago. 
His form dipped alarmingly last term, but the 26-year-old is expected to be in the running for the award yet again after scoring 10 goals in 30 appearances. Chelsea analysis: Hazard makes fools of Arsenal as Alonso shows hunger 
"Yes, maybe," he said after being asked if he is a more well-rounded player than in 2015. "With experience you get more. I think I'm a better player. But I think we are in better form as a team. It's not just me. 
"A couple of years ago I was on fire. Maybe I can score more goals this season. Two years ago I finished with maybe 13-14 [it was 19], I don't remember. We have a lot of games to play, we will see. 
"I try to be this kind of player that when I get the ball I do something. From the moment I get the ball, I try to do something. 
"Sometimes in the past, I don't touch the ball for 20-30 minutes. But now I try to touch the ball all the time and play my football for my team-mates. In Pictures | Chelsea vs Arsenal | 04/02/2017 In Pictures | Chelsea vs Arsenal | 04/02/2017 1/44
